name: Create a project card

params.name: note
params.description: The card's note content. Only valid for cards without another type of content, so you must omit when specifying `content_id` and `content_type`.

params.name: content_id
params.description:
The issue or pull request id you want to associate with this card. You can use the [List issues for a repository](/enterprise/2.12/v3/issues/#list-issues-for-a-repository) and [List pull requests](/enterprise/2.12/v3/pulls/#list-pull-requests) endpoints to find this id.  
**Note:** Depending on whether you use the issue id or pull request id, you will need to specify `Issue` or `PullRequest` as the `content_type`.

params.name: content_type
params.description: **Required if you provide `content_id`**. The type of content you want to associate with this card. Use `Issue` when `content_id` is an issue id and use `PullRequest` when `content_id` is a pull request id.

description:
**Note**: GitHub's REST API v3 considers every pull request an issue, but not every issue is a pull request. For this reason, "Issues" endpoints may return both issues and pull requests in the response. You can identify pull requests by the `pull_request` key.

Be aware that the `id` of a pull request returned from "Issues" endpoints will be an _issue id_. To find out the pull request id, use the "[List pull requests](/enterprise/2.12/v3/pulls/#list-pull-requests)" endpoint.

body.note: Add payload for delete Project column
